article_title: Realogy CFO: Saving a Highly Leveraged Company During a Downturn
article_text: A self-described owner of the balance sheet, Tom Bradley, executive vice president and CFO of Allied World Assurance Company Holdings, AG, discusses the importance of the CFO’s focus on capital and involvement in investor relations, as well as keeping the lines of communication open with talent and the investment community. He also talks about how being immersed in the business has helped him to understand the connection between the business, the balance sheet and the external world.

twitter.description: In 2009, Realogy’s debt was trading at 9 cents on the dollar, “as if investors expected us to make one more interest payment and then file for Chapter 11,” writes CFO Tony Hull in our latest guest column written by a CFO. Instead, three years later, Realogy went public, raising $1.2 billion, converting $2.1 billion of debt into equity.
